roleset.name: store
roleset.note: STOCK-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of Vncls spray-9.7-2, keep-15.2. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from stock.01-v)

example.name: ARG2 and ARG1
example.text: Walt Disney Co. 's Disneyland in Anaheim , Calif. , stocks rescue equipment , medical supplies , and enough food and water to feed at least 10,000 visitors for as long as five days in the event that a calamity isolates the theme park .
example.arg: Walt Disney Co. 's Disneyland in Anaheim , Calif. ,
rescue equipment , medical supplies , and enough food and water to feed at least 10,000 visitors for as long as five days in the event that a calamity isolates the theme park

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Stores in Hispanic areas will stock an assortment of Spanish - language magazines , Mexican cooking items and candies .
example.arg: an assortment of Spanish - language magazines , Mexican cooking items and candies

example.name: fish stock
example.text: He sold quarter-inch fingerlings [0]-2 [*T*-2]to stock other farmers' ponds, and he bought back one-pound-or-so food-fish that he ``live-hauled'' to market along with his own whiskery crop.

example.name: Arg0, 2
example.text: The Freshwater Fisheries Division has suspended their stocking of private ponds beginning fiscal year 2010.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: And while customers such as steel service centers are continuing to reduce inventories through the fourth quarter, they eventually will begin stocking up again, he notes.

example.name: transitive
example.text: Last year's drought in the Midwest prompted retailers to stock up on oils ahead of anticipated price increases, boosting sales for Crisco and Puritan oils, analysts said.
